content.title: Conducting of Exhibitions
content.details: The 'Conducting of Exhibitions' Component of the 'Development of Coir' Scheme aims to enhance awareness of diverse coir products and promote their market presence. It extends financial support, including a daily allowance of ₹150 per participant and travel reimbursements, to both local and outstation participants. The initiative emphasizes the eco-friendly nature of coir products.
benefits: Participants receive a daily allowance of ₹150 during the exhibition.
Travel expenses, in 2nd sleeper class, are provided for the journey from production units to the exhibition venue and back.
Actual transportation charges for transferring coir products from industrial units to the exhibition site are covered.
Free stall space is allocated to participants during the exhibition.
eligibility: Participants must be involved in coir production.
Local residents of Puducherry are eligible to apply.
content.application_process: Offline. Interested applicants should print the prescribed format of the application form, fill in all mandatory fields, paste a passport-sized photograph, and attach copies of all mandatory documents. The completed application should be submitted to the Project Manager (Cottage Industries) of the District Industries Centre in Thattanchavady, Puducherry.
documents_required: Proof of Possession of an Industrial Unit for Coir Products.
Any additional documentation required by the Department.

faqs.question: Can participants claim reimbursement for first-class travel expenses under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, participants can claim reimbursement for travel expenses in 2nd sleeper class only.

faqs.question: Is there any geographical restriction for the transfer of coir products under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, there is no geographical restriction mentioned for the transfer of coir products.

faqs.question: What is the primary financial support provided to participants under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The primary financial support includes a daily allowance of ₹150 and travel reimbursements.

faqs.question: Can local residents of Puducherry apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, local residents of Puducherry are eligible to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is there a specific daily allowance amount mentioned for participants during the exhibition?
faqs.answer: Yes, participants receive a daily allowance of ₹150.

faqs.question: Are there restrictions on the mode of transportation for eligible participants?
faqs.answer: Travel expenses are provided for the journey in 2nd sleeper class.

faqs.question: What type of units are eligible to apply for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Industrial units producing coir products are eligible to apply for the scheme.

faqs.question: Is stall space provided to participants during the exhibition, and at what cost?
faqs.answer: Yes, free stall space is allocated to participants during the exhibition.

faqs.question: Where should the applicant submit the filled application form and documents?
faqs.answer: The applicant should visit the Project Manager (Cottage Industries) of the District Industries Centre in Thattanchavady, Puducherry, during office hours, on a working day.

faqs.question: Is self-attestation required for all attached mandatory documents?
faqs.answer: Yes, the applicant should self-attest all required documents, as specified in the application process.
